results.abstract: The authorities arrested a 17-year-old who they said ran a scheme that targeted the accounts of celebrities, including former President Barack Obama and Elon Musk. Two others were also charged.

results.abstract: Nearly two-thirds of GEDmatch’s users opt out of helping law enforcement. For a brief window this month, that didn’t matter.

results.title: What Is Randonautica Really About?
results.abstract: An app that generates coordinates for adventurers claims to turn your thoughts into reality. TikTok and YouTube creators want you to believe it — but you shouldn’t.

results.title: I Tried to Live Without the Tech Giants. It Was Impossible.
results.abstract: As lawmakers debate whether Apple, Google, Facebook, and Amazon are monopolies, a reporter recalls her attempt to avoid interacting with the companies.

results.title: The Economy Is in Record Decline, but Not for the Tech Giants
results.abstract: Even though the tech industry’s four biggest companies were stung by a slowdown in spending, they reported a combined $28 billion in profits on Thursday.
results.byline: By Daisuke Wakabayashi, Karen Weise, Jack Nicas and Mike Isaac

results.title: Big Tech’s Backlash Is Just Starting

results.abstract: It is less clear that tech executives’ strategy of evasive answers will continue to work now that lawmakers have begun doing their homework.

results.abstract: The region’s lawmakers and regulators are taking direct aim at Amazon, Facebook, Google and Apple in a series of proposed laws.

results.title: Lawmakers, United in Their Ire, Lash Out at Big Tech’s Leaders

results.title: Turkey Passes Law Extending Sweeping Powers Over Social Media
results.abstract: The legislation extends control over platforms like Facebook, Twitter and YouTube. Critics worry it will be used to stifle dissent and criticism of the government.
